node.title: ‘Who the Heck Are You?’
node.alt: Brooke Todare, left, and Kathleen Kunkler.
node.description: When Kathleen Kunkler and Brooke Todare met in 2016, each got right to the point by peppering the other with the same blunt question.
node.content: ["Kathleen Marie Kunkler and Brooke Michele Todare met in October 2016, while both were attending the national convention of Women Leaders in College Sports in Kansas City, Mo.", "Ms. Todare, 35, then the vice president of external affairs of the upcoming 2017 N.C.A.A. Men\u2019s Final Four, sat down next to Ms. Kunkler, 61, who said she took one look at her and shouted, \u201cWho the heck are you, you\u2019re way too well dressed for this crowd.\u201d", "Ms. Todare, who was wearing a black dress and blazer, shot back, \u201cWell, who the heck are you?\u201d", "\u201cI thought she was red-hot,\u201d Ms. Kunkler said of Ms. Todare, who said she was feeling much the same, though both were seeing other people at the time.", "In October 2017, each returned to the convention, where they spoke to one another a bit more than the previous year.", "Ms. Todare learned that Ms. Kunkler was also the lead singer of a rock \u2018n\u2019 roll/blues band, called Kathleen & the One-Night-Stand Band.", "While both women were still spoken for, each acknowledged there was a chemistry between them.", "Later that month, a work-related meeting on Oct. 17, 2017, brought Ms. Kunkler to New York. When that meeting was over, she went walking through Central Park, taking the scenic route on her way to buy a new pair of shoes.", "She was still walking when her cellphone rang. It was Ms. Todare, who was now unattached, as was Ms. Kunkler.", "\u201cThat phone call could not have been more perfectly timed,\u201d Ms. Kunkler said. \u201cIt changed our lives forever.\u201d", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "A graduate of William Woods University in Fulton, Mo., where she earned a bachelor\u2019s degree in English communications, Ms. Kunkler is now a senior vice president, financial adviser and the global sports and entertainment director at Morgan Stanley in Kansas City, Mo., where she lives and grew up.", "Born and raised in Phoenix, Ms. Todare graduated from Arizona State University, from which she also received a master\u2019s degree in nonprofit studies. (She was also a four-year letterman in golf.) Ms. Todare is now the president of Global Diversity Logistics, a Phoenix-based company specializing in transportation services, which she founded in May 2017.", "After reconnecting on the phone, the two kept in touch on a regular basis for four months. Then, in February 2018, Ms. Todare traveled to Kansas City, Mo., at Ms. Kunkler\u2019s invitation, where she walked into a crowded bar that Ms. Kunkler was performing at with her band.", "\u201cShe spotted me immediately,\u201d Ms. Todare said, \u201cand pointed at me while she was singing.\u201d", "Ms. Kunkler said that the best part of the night was that \u201cBrooke got to go home with the leader of the band, and we\u2019ve been together ever since.\u201d", "In the years that they have been together, though, the two have lived apart: Ms. Todare, a lung cancer survivor, is now battling breast cancer and still resides in Phoenix.", "The couple married Nov. 11, at the Omni Scottsdale Resort & Spa at Montelucia in Scottsdale, Ariz., with Douglas Anning, a minister with American Marriage Ministries, officiating. Some 118 guests attended ceremony, with 250 attending a reception that followed; all were asked to be fully vaccinated.", "After the wedding, the pair traveled to Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, for a honeymoon. \u201cBeing together in Cabo was like spending four nights in heaven,\u201d said Ms. Kunkler, who, after the trip, had to return to Kansas City, Mo., where her 97-year-old mother, Joan Kunkler, resides in an assisted-living facility.", "Ms. Todare remained in Phoenix, where she underwent a double mastectomy at an area hospital on Dec. 2.", "\u201cLife happens,\u201d Ms. Todare said.", "But, Ms. Kunkler added, \u201cWe also know that the situation we are in right now will not last forever, things will get better.\u201d"]
